Description: Body sherd of Clazomenian black-figured pottery neck-amphora; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of woman's or siren's head with fillet in added red and skin in added white facing, to left; edge of panel to right, and top of panel, red line below uncertain motif, above.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

In his description on the sherd, Cook mentions both the body and head of a woman. Only the top of the head remains. For parallels regarding the figure, see Cambridge Fitzwilliam GR.43.1899 and GR.300b.1899.
Bibliographic references: CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 38, no. 10, pl. XIX)
Cook 1952 / A List of Clazomenian Pottery (p. 131, no. 12)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GH.120) (phase 3)
